item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6â€™s Liberty Falls Could Hold the Key to a Healthy Future For Zombies
item.description:
Though Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War 's Outbreak mode was an intriguing step in a new direction, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 's fully-fledged open-world Zombies mode was a big miss with fans. So, naturally, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's return to traditional round-based Zombies has been welcomed by the community with open arms.

At launch, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 shipped with two complete round-based Zombies maps: Terminus and Liberty Falls. Though these maps aren't perfect, they're arguably some of the best Zombies content fans have received in years, with each one being packed to the brim with Easter eggs and secrets. But Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 didn't leave it there. Season 1 added Citadelle des Morts to Black Ops 6 , a sprawling Zombies map set in a European castle, hearkening back to beloved maps like Black Ops 3 's Der Eisendrache. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has set a high bar for itself for future seasons, but the key to continued success might be hiding in Liberty Falls' blueprint.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Should Use Liberty Falls as a Blueprint for its Future Seasons

Not All Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Seasons Can Come With a Citadelle des Morts

A surprisingly large map filled with interweaving hallways, underground tunnels, ancient halls, and a neighboring village, Citadelle des Morts, for the most part, lived up to the hype. Along with its larger scale and clever interconnected map design, Citadelle des Morts introduced four new Wonder Weapons to the franchise, along with unique Easter egg quests to find and upgrade each one. A new enemy type, the Doppleghast, was also added with the map.

While it's unconfirmed how long Citadelle des Morts took to develop, it was presumably no small feat, with so much new content being packed into its castle walls. Though Treyarch and its team of co-developers are all very talented, it seems unlikely they'd be able to produce a new Zombies map on a similar scale to Citadelle des Morts for every new Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 season.

But fans will still crave new Zombies content, and there might be a way for Treyarch to offer that without needing to resort to crunch.

Smaller Liberty Falls-Like Maps Would Offer a Great Balance

The smaller of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies' two launch day offerings, Liberty Falls was criticized before launch for lacking atmosphere, seeming too simplistic, and for having Operators instead of a fully-voiced cast. When players finally got their hands on Liberty Falls, those criticisms didn't necessarily go away, but they weren't nearly as loud.

Liberty Falls does a great job of doing exactly what it sets out to do, being a smaller map designed primarily to introduce newcomers to the mode. But despite its smaller scale and deliberately simplistic design, Liberty Falls still has all the trimmings fans would expect from a traditional round-based Zombies map, such as Perk-a-Colas, Wonder Weapons, Easter eggs, and the Mystery Box.

If Treyarch intends to produce a new Zombies map every season, then it might want to use Liberty Falls as the blueprint for some of those maps, perhaps rotating between a large-scale Citadelle des Morts-like map and a smaller Liberty Falls-like map every two seasons. This could be a great way to keep development pressures down while still offering fans new Zombies content at a consistent rate.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: How to Ride the Blue Grand Crane
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Infinity Nikki: How to Unlock Blue Grand Crane
  • Infinity Nikki: Blue Grand Crane Location
  • Infinity Nikki: How to Ride the Blue Grand Crane

Infinity Nikki 's Into a Starry Night event gives players the opportunity to complete many tasks, each of which awards Starlight Shards. One of the tasks on Day 2 of the event instructs fans to ride the blue grand crane that is available exclusively for the Wish Festival in Florawish, and players who want to assemble the Path of Starlight outfit should definitely try to address it. This guide is here to elaborate upon how that is done, and it will help players ride the blue grand crane in Infinity Nikki .

While the task suggests that players must ride a blue crane, that is actually not the case. Indeed, riding a white crane will also count toward the task's completion. A white crane can be found flying around the Dream Warehouse's exterior, and dress-up game fans can reach its position by following the steps that are detailed in the "Blue Grand Crane Location" section that is below.

Infinity Nikki: How to Unlock Blue Grand Crane

The first step towards finding the blue grand crane is progressing the questline that is associated with the Shining Wish event . That questline unlocks upon completion of Infinity Nikki 's Go to Dream Warehouse quest at the end of the game's second chapter, and it begins with the Good Decor, Bad Decor quest. After completing Good Decor, Bad Decor, players will start Save the Wishing Nebula! , and the blue grand crane will take flight during that quest.

Infinity Nikki: Blue Grand Crane Location

After unlocking the blue grand crane, Infinity Nikki players can find it in the sky around the Dream Warehouse . For full clarity, the Dream Warehouse is in northwest Florawish , and here is a good way to locate the crane:

  1. Travel to the Dream Warehouse Rooftop Warp Spire.
  2. Follow the stone path that extends from the Warp Spire.
  3. Jump onto the tower at the end of the path. The blue grand crane will eventually fly underneath that position.

Players who take these actions will also find that a white crane flies very close to the tower near the Dream Wareshouse Rooftop Warp Spire. While this crane is definitely not blue, riding it will cause the "ride the blue grand crane" task to be marked as complete.

Infinity Nikki: How to Ride the Blue Grand Crane

As the blue crane approaches the player's position, they should simply jump on top to ride it. The Bubbly Voyage ability outfit in Infinity Nikki , which allows Nikki to float, makes it fairly easy to land on the blue crane, and fans will have completed the associated task as soon as their feet come into contact with the bird. Players can then claim their 100-Starlight Shard reward by opening the Events menu, selecting the Into a Starry Night tab, and clicking on the task within Day 2.

item.title: Dalton Cooper's Top 10 Video Games of 2024
item.description:
While 2023 is championed as one of the best years in gaming history in terms of new game releases, 2024 was certainly no slouch. All year long, gamers were treated to all kinds of high-quality new game releases from a wide range of genres and platforms.

I played dozens of new games in 2024, with these 10 standing out as my favorites. In fact, some of these games have become part of my all-time favorites, and I can see myself coming back to them for years to come. Please keep in mind that this is my own personal top 10 list , and not reflective of Game Rant's official top 10 list.

My 10 Favorite Video Games of 2024

10. Neva

9. Animal Well

8. Marvel Rivals

7. Metaphor: ReFantazio

6. Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown

5. The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

4. Silent Hill 2 (2024)

3. Balatro

2. Lorelei and the Laser Eyes

1. Astro Bot

When it comes to 2024 games, few have quite the emotional impact of Neva , an engrossing puzzle-platformer about a woman going on an epic adventure with her wolf to rid the world of evil. Neva 's gorgeous art style and brilliant musical score combined with its heart-wrenching narrative made it impossible to put the controller down. Neva is a brief but incredible experience that has stuck with me in a way that few other games this year have. But Neva wasn't the only amazing indie to release in 2024. Joining it is Animal Well , the first game published by Dunkey's Bigmode label. An eye-popping Metroidvania, Animal Well 's gadgets ensure that the gameplay is constantly evolving, giving players new ways to tackle its various platforming challenges.

As far as competitive multiplayer games go, I had a hard time choosing between Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Marvel Rivals when putting together my list of favorite 2024 games, but I think I have to give the edge to the latter. I'm a huge fan of Overwatch and have been playing it regularly for years, but Marvel Rivals is the first game to really pull me away. It's somewhat light on content right now in terms of maps and modes, but Marvel Rivals ' huge roster of 33 playable heroes ensures that there still hasn't been a dull moment. It's become my new go-to PvP shooter game, and I can see it being my most-played game of next year.

Another 2024 game I plan on revisiting in 2025 is Metaphor Re:Fantazio . Metaphor: ReFantazio pulled me into its game world and never let go throughout its entire runtime. A gigantic JRPG, Metaphor: ReFantazio takes elements from the Persona games and applies them to a medieval fantasy setting, complete with political intrigue, plenty of surprise twists and turns, and all sorts of grotesque monsters. Metaphor has become one of my favorite turn-based RPGs ever, and I can't wait to dive back into its world.

Metaphor was one of my favorite games to release in the back-half of the year, but 2024 didn't wait long to put out bangers. One of the first major new releases of the year was Metroidvania Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown . A criminally underplayed Ubisoft game, Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown features some of the year's best boss fights, brought to life with intense action and flashy visuals.

The Lost Crown was an excellent new entry in one of gaming's longest-running franchises, and so too was Echoes of Wisdom . The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom was, in my opinion, the best Switch exclusive release of 2024. Bringing back the cute diorama art style last seen in the Link's Awakening remake, Echoes of Wisdom finally put Princess Zelda in the starring role. It also outfitted her with the Tri Rod, which lets her clone objects and enemies to solve puzzles and fight monsters. A short but sweet Zelda adventure, Echoes of Wisdom was one of the most consistently engaging games I played all year.

The same goes for the Silent Hill 2 remake. Like many other Silent Hill fans, I was skeptical Bloober Team would be able to pull the remake off in a way that lived up to the high bar set by the original, but I was wrong. The Silent Hill 2 remake successfully brings the PS2 classic to modern standards with its haunting game world, expanded areas, and simple yet brutal close-quarters combat. It's now one of my favorite horror games and has left me incredibly excited about Bloober Team's future projects.

I'll also be keeping an eye on future games made by LocalThunk. The solo developer's Balatro , a roguelike deck-builder that brilliantly leverages Poker elements, is one of the most addicting new games released this year. Nominated for a Game of the Year award alongside giants like Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth and Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree , Balatro has a sort of timeless quality to it that reminds me of classic puzzle game Tetris .

Puzzle game fans had a lot of high-quality games to choose from in 2024, but none quite match Lorelei and the Laser Eyes . Lorelei and the Laser Eyes pays homage to classic survival-horror games in terms of its structure and exploration, but trades combat and scares for brutally-difficult puzzles. It's one of the most fascinating, unique games I have ever played and, while it's certainly not for everybody, it's one of my favorite gaming experiences all year.

But the game that is my favorite new release of 2024 is by far Astro Bot . With Astro Bot , Team Asobi has delivered one of the best 3D platformers of all time, a game that can stand tall with the Super Mario s of the world. Astro Bot 's only goal is for the player to have fun, and in that, it excels. Astro Bot is a masterclass of game design, taking full advantage of the PS5's unique capabilities. Astro Bot has only gotten better since launch, with new updates that have added fresh levels for players to conquer, including speedrun levels and an adorable Christmas-themed stage.

2024 featured some amazing games, and 2025 looks like it could be even better. Between the release of Grand Theft Auto 6 and the launch of the Switch 2, 2025 should be a tremendous year for the industry.

item.title: Trunk of Funk Bots and Puzzle Pieces - Astro Bot Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Puzzle Piece 1
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 1
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 2
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Puzzle Piece 2
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 3
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 4
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 5
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 6
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Puzzle Piece 3
  • Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 7

Astro Bot's Trunk of Funk stage has seven Bots to rescue and three secret Puzzle Pieces to collect. Here's a guide on where to find them to help you get one step closer to getting the coveted Platinum Trophy for Astro Bot .

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Puzzle Piece 1

Right when Trunk of Funk starts, you'll fly on the ship for a few seconds. After passing two coin boxes, look out for a cave on the right side with a puzzle piece at the end of it as a reward. If you miss it, just do a quick restart.

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 1

Behind the big dehydrated plant, you'll see a Bot riding atop a deer. Go ahead and smack it to rescue it.

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 2

Continue on the path until you spot a big pink mushroom. There's one of those driller mole enemies in front of it, so deal with it, and then rescue the Bot on the 'shroom.

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Puzzle Piece 2

You'll find a mole holding a golf ball on the right side of the tree. Aim correctly, and smack the ball into the goal hole near the tree. The puzzle piece will appear once you get it in. If you miss it, The mole will return with a new golf ball, so don't worry about getting it right on the first try.

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 3

After you exit the giant tree and hit a checkpoint, look to the right to find a lone purple blob on a far platform. Use your platform-growing costume to reach it. Look on the platform behind the monster to find a Bot trapped in a bird's egg inside a nest.

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 4

When you reach a checkpoint with a huge smiley face balloon, return inside and turn around to find more platforms higher up. They will lead to a nest with a string underneath that you can pull to find a hidden Bot.

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 5

After you pass the smiley face balloon, you'll see a line of coins leading to a faraway platform. The Bot is over there. However, skip the coins for now and head to the upper platform, passing the purple goop monster. Hit the checkpoint, grab the ooze from in front of the large heart-eyed caterpillar, and use your magic platforms to reach the Bot.

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 6

Instead of going to the right when you see the caterpillar with heart eyes, go left to find a hidden area. Push in the correct block by feeling the vibration on your PS5 controller, and you'll find the Spirit Guide Bot inspired by Kena .

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Puzzle Piece 3

When you pass the honeycomb section, you'll find another giant plant in front of a smiley face balloon. Use the nearby honey pad to get some air, then defeat the plant. You'll see a puzzle piece trapped in honey, so suck it up and grab it for your collection.

Astro Bot - Trunk of Funk Bot 7

Eventually, you'll see a zipper on the wall behind two of those enemies that have liquid inside of them for you to suck up. Defeat them after they toss their hats (or heads?) at you, and then unzip the wall. Enter the new area and head to the left to find another Bot on a honey pad.

Congrats --you've found everything in Trunk of Funk .

item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks Major Details About Mizuki Kit
item.description:
Summary

  • A recent Genshin Impact leak revealed the potential new character Mizuki, an Anemo user.
  • Update 5.3, released on December 31, adds the long-awaited Pyro Archon as a playable character.
  • Mizuki should be a new five-star Anemo catalyst, leading many players to believe she might have a similar playstyle to the popular Wanderer.

A Genshin Impact leak has revealed numerous details about a potential new character named Mizuki, who is expected to join the roster in one of the upcoming updates. As per usual, Genshin Impact is very busy this time of year, as it typically introduces a new Archon to the roster around this time.

Developer HoYoverse has officially confirmed that the upcoming Genshin Impact update 5.3 will finally include the long-awaited Pyro Archon as a playable character. While Mavuika is yet to officially become playable, new leaks have been unveiling a lot of information about a mysterious character named Mizuki.

Previous Genshin Impact leaks revealed that a character previously codenamed Kamisato Ayano has had her name changed to Mizuki. Many credible leakers have started to share more information about this character and her potential on the battlefield. According to multiple rumors, Mizuki should be a new 5-star Anemo catalyst, leading many players to believe she might have a similar playstyle to the popular Wanderer. A post on the Genshin Impact Leaks subreddit by a credible leaker named Seele has revealed Mizuki's complete kit.

Genshin Impact: Mizuki Kit Details Leaked

  • Elemental Skill : Mizuki enters a floating state that deals AoE damage to nearby enemies. During this state, Mizuki gains increased Swirl damage potential, which scales with her Elemental Mastery. Triggering Genshin Impact 's Swirl reaction while in this state will extend the duration of the floating effect.
  • Elemental Burst : Mizuki deals AoE damage and pulls in enemies while summoning an on-field effect called Tapir. Tapir creates Snacks that Mizuki's team members can interact with. If their HP is above a certain threshold, the Snack will explode, dealing damage, but it will also heal if they are at low HP. These items will apparently remain on the field even if Mizuki is swapped out, hinting that she might also possess decent supportive potential in Genshin Impact.

One of Mizuki's Passive Talents will increase her Elemental Mastery by 100 if she has a Pyro, Hydro, Cryo, or Electro character in her team composition. Fans have praised this decision, noting that the release of Genshin Impact 's Dendro element during the Sumeru arc had pushed certain elemental reactions out of the meta.

Overall, players seem excited about Mizuki's character, claiming that she appears to be a powerful combination of Wanderer and Genshin Impact 's Anemo Archon Venti. As for her release date, while HoYoverse has yet to make an official announcement, many leakers believe that she will arrive during Genshin Impact Version 5.4.
